result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan L Opall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Megan L Opall in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered this case dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Megan L Opall in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense informs the court that they are continuing to trial.
All offers are revoked.
Case remains calendared in Branch 36 for trial.

15RM026141  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/21/2015

Defendant Megan L Opall in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Status Conference.  Court GRANTED state's motion of joinder of 14CM2697 & 15CM1632. Court GRANTED adjournment to allow for joined jury trial.  Case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with JEREMIAH R or his children/home/school/work.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Megan L Opall in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Megan L Opall in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23 due to lower pending case 14CM2697.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
